name: The Striatal Subregional VOImap
short_description:
Striatal Subregional VOImap is intended to provide accurate data in terms of specific uptake location to make the BP quantitation. Available in .obj format. 
VOIs were manually drawn with software Analyze 9,0 (Mayo Clinic) in 18F-DOPA brain image after spatial normalization with a 18F-DOPA Template developed by our group (available at: https://www.nitrc.org/projects/spmtemplates). Each striatum was divided into 6 sub-regions: ventral caudate, anterior dorsal caudate, posterior dorsal caudate, ventral putamen, anterior dorsal putamen and posterior dorsal putamen, based on Mawlawi et al. (J Cereb Blood Flow Metab.2001;21:1034–57) and Oh et al. (J Nucl Med.2012;53:399–406) segmentation. Nonspecific background volume was drawn in the occipital cortex.

Terms of use:
Striatal Subregional VOImap is intended for free use by the neuroimaging community. However, we do ask that you please cite.

J.A. Lojo-Ramírez, F.J. García-Gómez & D. García-Solís.
Contact: jalojoram@gmail.com
summary: Six striatal sub-regional volumes of interest to BP quantitation
